description: The bucket stores archived data that is rarely accessed, typically less than once a year.
The bucket contains files that are frequently restored for daily use from Glacier storage.
The bucket maintains versioning for objects and keeps all versions indefinitely, with old versions accumulating over time.
The bucket contains large multipart uploads that have remained incomplete for a long time.
The bucket stores millions of small log files that are uploaded continuously throughout the day.
The bucket replicates all data to another AWS region even though there are no applications using the replicated data.
Applications perform frequent full scans to list all objects in the bucket, leading to many LIST operations each hour.
